Glenview/Northbrook COVID-19 Task Force 4/10 Update on Coronavirus

a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

a.span: Acceptable Use of District 31 Technology Network

h1.span: Glenview/Northbrook COVID-19 Task Force 4/10 Update on Coronavirus

p.span: April 10
Subject: Community Collaboration: April 10 Update on Coronavirus (COVID-19)
Please see the below communication from the Glenview/ Northbrook COVID-19 Task Force.

Members of the Glenview/Northbrook COVID-19 Task Force continue to work together to protect the safety, health and well-being of the citizens we serve. We have regular conversations to understand our immediate situation, constantly monitor the state and federal mandates that impact us, and look ahead to consider the decisions we will face as individual organizations and a collective community as we move past the current restrictive environment.
In several past messages, we have shared prevention tips. In this message, we ask that you go right to the source:

a.span: the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) offers very clear advice on how to prevent the spread of coronavirus

p.span: . Note that the CDC recently updated its recommendations to include wearing masks or other face protection whenever you are out in public.

a.span: Here is CDC guidance on face coverings

p.span: NorthShore University HealthSystem reports that, as expected, the hospitals in the system are seeing a steady rise in COVID-19 testing and in confirmed cases. They are working with faith-based, service and civic organizations to reach out to community members to check in on their health and provide information on when and how to seek testing and care. Those who have symptoms should be screened for testing. The following are symptoms of COVID-19:

li.span: Loss or decrease in the sense of smell
Loss or decrease of the sense of taste

p.span: If you or anyone in your household is experiencing even one of those symptoms, you are urged to be screened immediately to determine if you need testing. You can:

li.span: and talk to a NorthShore clinical expert; or
through the app on your mobile device or on the website (

p.span: NorthShore reports that their supply of PPE is currently sufficient and staff members, who are trained in proper PPE use, feel protected. The hospitals continue to accept financial, critical supply and other donations.
The Northfield Township Food Pantry is seeing a rise in residents needing support.
If you live in Northfield Township and need assistance with rent, food or other financial strains, contact the township office at 847-724-8300. Remember,

a.span: the Food Pantry is accepting donations and volunteers age 16 and up

p.span: to help them keep up with this increasing demand.
We strongly urge you to comply with Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzkers stay-at-home orders, but we hope that youll find ways to stay connected in the community.

a.span: The Glenview Northbrook Coronavirus Response website

p.span: includes links to resources to support your mental health, and it also links to all of our organizations. We all are here, virtually, to answer your questions, provide information and support, or to just say hello.

If you follow any of us on our social media channels, youll get a healthy dose of stories that highlight the strength of our community and the boundless goodness of those who live and work here. We will share some of those stories here each week.
Richard Nahrstadt, Village Manager, Northbrook
Matt Formica, Village Manager, Glenview
Jill Brickman, Northfield Township Supervisor
Dr. Charles Johns, Superintendent, Glenbrook High Schools District 225
Dr. David Kroeze, Superintendent, Northbrook School District 27
Dr. Larry Hewitt, Superintendent, Northbrook School District 28
Dr. Brian Wegley, Superintendent, Northbrook/Glenview School District 30
Dr. Erin Murphy, Superintendent, West Northfield School District 31
Dr. Dane Delli, Superintendent, Glenview School District 34
Michael McCarty, Executive Director, Glenview Park District
Molly Hamer, Executive Director, Northbrook Park District
Kate H
all, Executive Director, Northbrook Public Library
Vickie Novak, Director, Glenview Public Library
Betsy Baer, Executive Director, Glenview Chamber of Commerce
Tensley Garris, President, Northbrook Chamber of Commerce

Los miembros del Grupo de trabajo Glenview / Northbrook COVID-19 continan trabajando juntos para proteger la seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de los ciudadanos a los que servimos. Tenemos conversaciones peridicas para comprender nuestra situacin inmediata, monitorear constantemente los mandatos estatales y federales que nos impactan, y mirar hacia adelante para considerar las decisiones que enfrentaremos como organizaciones individuales y una comunidad colectiva a medida que avanzamos ms all del entorno restrictivo actual.
En varios mensajes anteriores, hemos compartido consejos de prevencin. En este mensaje, le pedimos que vaya directamente a la fuente:

a.span: los Centros para el Control y la Prevencin de Enfermedades (CDC) ofrecen consejos muy claros sobre cmo prevenir la propagacin del coronavirus

p.span: . Tenga en cuenta que los CDC actualizaron recientemente sus recomendaciones para incluir el uso de mscaras u otra proteccin facial cada vez que est en pblico.

a.span: Aqu hay una gua de los CDC sobre revestimientos faciales.

p.span: NorthShore University HealthSystem informa que, como se esperaba, los hospitales en el sistema estn viendo un aumento constante en las pruebas de COVID-19 y en casos confirmados. Estn trabajando con organizaciones religiosas, de servicio y cvicas para comunicarse con los miembros de la comunidad para verificar su salud y proporcionar informacin sobre cundo y cmo buscar pruebas y atencin. Aquellos que tienen sntomas deben ser examinados para la prueba. Los siguientes son sntomas de COVID-19:

li.span: Prdida o disminucin del sentido del olfato.
Prdida o disminucin del sentido del gusto.
Dolores corporales parecidos a la gripe

p.span: Si usted o alguien en su hogar est experimentando incluso uno de esos sntomas, se le recomienda que se haga un examen de inmediato para determinar si necesita hacerse la prueba. Usted puede:

li.span: y hable con un experto clnico de NorthShore; o
a travs de la aplicacin en su dispositivo mvil o en el sitio web (

p.span: NorthShore informa que el suministro de equipo de proteccin personal (EPP) es actualmente suficiente y los miembros del personal, capacitados en el uso adecuado del EPP, se sienten protegidos. Los hospitales continan aceptando suministros crticos, aportaciones econmicas y otras donaciones.

a.span: Visite su sitio web para obtener informacin.

p.span: La despensa de alimentos del municipio de Northfield est viendo un aumento en los residentes que necesitan apoyo.
p.strong: Si vive en el municipio de Northfield y necesita ayuda con el alquiler, la comida u otras dificultades financieras, comunquese con la oficina del municipio al 847-724-8300.
p.span: Recuerde,

a.span: la despensa de comida est aceptando donaciones y voluntarios de 16 aos en adelante

p.span: para ayudarlos a mantenerse al da con esta creciente demanda.

p.strong: Qudese en casa, pero mantngase conectado

p.span: Le recomendamos encarecidamente que cumpla con las rdenes del gobernador de Illinois J.B. Pritzker de quedarse en casa, pero esperamos que encuentre formas de mantenerse conectado en la comunidad.

a.span: El sitio web de Glenview Northbrook Coronavirus Response

p.span: incluye enlaces a recursos para apoyar su salud mental, y tambin enlaces a todas nuestras organizaciones. Todos estamos aqu, virtualmente, para responder sus preguntas, proporcionar informacin y soporte, o simplemente para saludar.

Si nos sigue a cualquiera de nuestros canales de redes sociales, obtendr una buena dosis de historias que destacan la fortaleza de nuestra comunidad y la bondad ilimitada de quienes viven y trabajan aqu. Compartiremos algunas de esas historias aqu cada semana.
Fax
